title.narrative: Age and Disability Capacity Building program (ADCAP)

description.narrative: Evidence is available to assess effectiveness of inclusion of ageing and disability in humanitarian programmes.
Humanitarian actors globally have access to resources on inclusion of older people and persons with disability which allows them to deliver inclusive and effective humanitarian responses.
Individual and organisational capacities of partner organisations are enhanced to integrate ageing and disability within their own policies, plans and programmes.

This project aims to build the capacity of several implementing partners on age and disability inclusion in Pakistan and Kenya. The project builds awareness and capacity of international and national humanitarian actors to respond to the specific needs of OP and PwD, and ultimately support mainstreaming of response to the needs of these groups and reduce the protection risks they face in crisis. This outcome will be achieved via a training-of-trainers approach used to train national-level age and disability inclusion “Focal Points” in both specialist age and disability and mainstream humanitarian agencies.

mailing-address.narrative: Tavis House, 1-6 Tavistock Square, London WC1H 9NA

recipient-country.narrative: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland (The)
